sentences.english: Yedisan Tatars traded there in the 14th century.
sentences.chinese: 十四世纪，东欧的鞑靼人在此从事贸易。

sentences.english: After the Tatars were defeated, Russia could turn against Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 在鞑靼人被击败后，露西亚可以转身对付瑞典。

sentences.english: The attack cleared the Tatars from the field, and continued the chase.
sentences.chinese: 这次袭击从战场上清除了鞑靼人，并继续追击。

sentences.english: Tatars no longer dared attack the southern Russian border and in 1598 also made a peace with Russia.
sentences.chinese: 鞑靼人再也不敢袭击露西亚南部边境。

sentences.english: The Tartars employed another weapon, the so-called Chinese dragon belching fire.
sentences.chinese: 鞑靼人使用了另一种武器，所谓中国龙喷火器。

sentences.english: Despite being sacked and burnt by the invading Tartars in the next century.
sentences.chinese: 尽管在十三世纪里历经了鞑靼人入侵的劫掠和烧毁。

sentences.english: Tartar evolutions are indicated by flags which are lowered, like marine signals.
sentences.chinese: 鞑靼人变阵是通过旗帜的降低来表示，就像海事信号。

definition: Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
nomadic/to move about in search of pasture/to rove around as a nomad
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
